data.title: Admissions
data.meta_description: We’re glad you’re considering Hope College! All first-year and transfer students apply to Hope using the Common Application.
data.text:
High school students wanting to take courses at Hope for dual enrollment before graduating from high school need to apply and work with their school for financing. Dual Enrollment is available to students from participating high schools (or homeschool) with a minimum of a 3.0 high school GPA.

Application

Complete our Dual Enrollment Application, including the name & email address of two recommenders (parent/guardian and high school official or counselor).

Each recommender will receive an email with a form to complete on your behalf.

Your HS official will also upload the most recent version of your high school transcript.

Financing and Payment

Hope's financial participation is limited to one course per semester.

Fees for credit hours taken above the one course this program covers will be based on the rate identified for the total number of registered credits.

Parents will be responsible for any outstanding costs incurred by their student enrolled at Hope College.

The PSEO Act requires Hope to bill the school district directly. After reimbursement, based on the student's allowance, Hope will bill the student for the remaining charges.

The payment expected from each student will vary depending on the situations, below:

High School Policy: Public high schools may participate in the Postsecondary Enrollment Options Act (PSEO). Please check with your guidance counselor to see if you are eligible for this program.

Hope Scholarship Offered: Up to 50% tuition waiver (for one class) is awarded to students with a cumulative High School grade point average of 3.5 or greater, regardless of year in school.

Parents’ Employed at Hope: Contact Hope College Human Resources for information on tuition waiver benefits.

We will contact you with information about registering for classes after receiving your completed application. We offer a variety of courses for dual-enrolling students but our degree-seeking students are given first priority when space is limited.

If you’d like to take a course or two at Hope but aren’t interested in working toward a degree at this time, here’s how to apply:

Complete our Single Term Enrollment Application for non-degree seeking students.

Please submit this application for each semester or term you wish to take a course at Hope College.
